page.title: 11Animals Kirmington & Croxton
page.content:
Thirty years ago these farms had flocks of sheep and cattle for fattening,breeding or milk. But today are almost entirely arable. Four farmers have some sheep on the farm for short periods, to graze on sugar beet tops,rye grass or small areas of grassland. On two farms there are several horses. Cattle are grazed on Dam field Croxton (near to the pond and Pond Close Wood) and on a grass field at Grange Farm Croxton.
In the village of Kirmington, there are three households who keep Goats, and several keep bees. There are two farmers wives who keep 50 to 100 hens,and sell eggs in the shop or at Brigg market.There are also ten other famlies who have hens.
